title: Akshay Kumar Pens Heartfelt Note For Niece Simar Bhatia Ahead Of Her Debut In Ikkis: 'Puttar Tu Kamal Hai' - News18
summary:
Akshay Kumar Pens Heartfelt Note For Niece Simar Bhatia Ahead Of Her Debut In Ikkis: 'Puttar Tu Kamal Hai'

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: News18

Akshay Kumar shares a heartfelt message for his niece Simar Bhatia ahead of her Bollywood debut.

  • Simar Bhatia, daughter of Akshay's sister Alka, is making her film debut in the movie Ikkis.
  • Akshay Kumar expressed his pride and emotions in an Instagram post.
  • The film Ikkis tells a poignant story based on the 1971 Indo-Pak War.
  • Simar's role as the romantic lead opposite Agastya Nanda is highly anticipated.
  • The movie is set to premiere on January 10, 2025.
“I remember the first time I saw my photo on the cover of the newspaper... I wish my mom was here today and she would have said ‘Simar puttar tu tah Kamaal hai’. Bless you my baby, the sky is yours.”

This touching message by Akshay Kumar reflects a strong family bond and excitement for Simar's future in the film industry.
newTitle: Akshay Kumar Post Heartwarming Tribute to Niece Simar Bhatia for Her Upcoming Film Ikkis

title: K-netizens react to 'Squid Game 2' missing out at the 'Golden Globes' - allkpop
summary:
K-netizens React to 'Squid Game 2' Missing Out at the Golden Globes

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: allkpop

'Squid Game 2' failed to win an award at this year's Golden Globes, marking the second time the series missed out on the Best Drama Award.

  • The 82nd Golden Globe Awards took place in Los Angeles.
  • 'Squid Game 2' was nominated for Best Television Series - Drama.
  • 'Shōgun' won the award, with director Hwang Dong Hyuk expressing gratitude for the nomination.
  • Korean netizens have mixed reactions, with some accepting the loss as expected.
"I am truly thankful that a show that hasn’t even aired yet was nominated for such a prestigious award." - Hwang Dong Hyuk

The reactions from netizens vary significantly, with some critical of the show's early production timeline and quality.

title: A.R. Rahman Launches Bharat Maestro Awards for Indian Classical Music (EXCLUSIVE) - Variety
summary:
A.R. Rahman Launches Bharat Maestro Awards for Indian Classical Music

Date: [Insert Publication Date] | Source: Variety

Oscar, BAFTA, Golden Globe, and Grammy-winning composer A.R. Rahman and the KM Music Conservatory have unveiled the Bharat Maestro Awards, a new initiative celebrating Indian classical music and its practitioners.

  • The awards feature three categories: young musician awards, a lifetime achievement honor for educators, and a state medallion for regional contributions to classical music preservation.
  • A notable mentor panel includes Asha Bhosle, Amjad Ali Khan, and Bombay Jayashri.
  • Winners will receive cash prizes and perform internationally, collaborating with Rahman.
  • The awards follow the traditional guru-shishya format for presentation.
“The greatest joy of a guru is to witness the success and growth of their students...,” said Rahman.

The launch coincided with the KM Music Conservatory’s 16th anniversary, further bridging tradition and modernity in music education.
newTitle: A.R. Rahman Launches Bharat Maestro Awards for Indian Classical Music

title: Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid - News18
summary:

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Two Ram Charan fans tragically lost their lives after attending the film's pre-release event in Rajahmundry. The families will receive financial assistance from the producer Dil Raju.

  • The victims were identified as Arava Manikanta (23) and Thokada Charan (22).
  • They were involved in a fatal accident on their way home after the event.
  • Dil Raju has pledged Rs 10 lakh to support the families affected.
  • Pawan Kalyan also promised Rs 5 lakh each to the victims’ families.
  • This incident follows another tragic event where a woman died at a Pushpa 2 screening.
“I pray that their souls rest in peace, and we will stand by and support the two families.” - Dil Raju

  • Jaideep Ahlawat reprises his role as Inspector Hathi Ram Chaudhary in an eight-episode narrative.

title: Mumbai gynaecologist Dr Rustom Soonawala, trusted by Bollywood stars, dies at 95 - The Indian Express
summary:
Mumbai Gynaecologist Dr. Rustom Soonawala Passes Away at 95

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Indian Express

Dr. Rustom Soonawala, a renowned gynaecologist who assisted in the births of celebrity offspring including Kareena and Ranbir Kapoor, has passed away at the age of 95 after a prolonged illness. He was celebrated for his kindness, professionalism, and significant contributions to women's health.

  • Inventor of the polyethylene intra-uterine device in the 1960s.
  • A Padmashree awardee and former professor emeritus at Wadia Maternity Hospital.
  • Highly respected by both patients and staff for his compassionate nature.
  • Mentor to many young doctors and an inspirational figure in the medical field.
“He was gentle not just with patients but everyone.” - Dr. Duru Shah

Dr. Soonawala's legacy continues with the impact he had on the lives of countless mothers and healthcare professionals, and his teachings remain relevant today.
newTitle: Mumbai Gynaecologist Dr. Rustom Soonawala Passes Away at 95

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Pushpa 2 has officially dethroned Baahubali 2 to become the highest-grossing film in India, crossing ₹1438 crore in just 32 days since its release.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed ₹1831 crore worldwide.
  • It surpassed the previous record held by Baahubali 2 for over 8 years.
  • Pushpa 2: The Rule was released on December 5, 2024.
  • It is a sequel to the successful 2021 film, Pushpa: The Rise.
  • Pushpa 3 has been announced but no shooting plans are currently in place.
“#Pushpa2TheRule is now Indian Cinema's INDUSTRY HIT with THE HIGHEST EVER COLLECTION FOR A MOVIE IN INDIA,” the team announced.

The success of Pushpa 2 highlights the growing dominance of Indian cinema on a global scale.

Source: Indian Express

Ram Kapoor shares his personal struggles with weight loss after losing 30 kgs twice and regaining it each time. His recent transformation of losing 55 kgs highlights the need for deeper personal changes beyond dieting.

  • Ram Kapoor emphasizes the importance of a mindset shift for sustainable weight loss.
  • The diet industry is criticized for its structure that promotes failure and requires repeat customers.
  • Dr. Jagadish Hiremath discusses the need for psychological and behavioral changes for lasting wellness.
  • Education and self-awareness are vital for making informed choices about health and weight loss.
“The entire dieting industry, which is more than a 20 billion dollar industry, is designed to make you fail.” - Ram Kapoor

title: More legal woes for Nayanthara over Netflix documentary as Chandramukhi makers sue for using clips without permission - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nayanthara Faces New Legal Trouble Over Unauthorized Clips in Documentary

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Lady superstar Nayanthara is facing another legal dispute regarding her wedding documentary, Nayanthara: Beyond the Fairytale, streaming on Netflix. After a notice from Dhanush last year, the makers of Chandramukhi are now suing for unauthorized use of their footage.

  • The makers of Chandramukhi claim clips from their 2005 film were used without permission in Nayanthara's documentary.
  • They are seeking ₹5 crore in compensation from Nayanthara and Netflix.
  • This is not the first legal issue for Nayanthara regarding this documentary, as she faced a similar suit from Dhanush.
  • The documentary features intimate moments from Nayanthara's wedding to Vignesh Shivan and includes scenes from her films.
“Nayanthara has not yet responded to the allegations.”

How Nayanthara will handle this new legal issue remains to be seen, particularly as Chandramukhi significantly contributed to her rise in Tamil cinema.
newTitle: Nayanthara Faces Legal Trouble Over Unauthorized Use of Film Clips in Netflix Documentary

“In those moments when we don’t think we are smart enough or pretty enough, or skinny enough or successful enough... I treat this as a marker that I do belong.” — Demi Moore

This historic win marks a significant milestone for Demi Moore and highlights the support of her family in her journey.
newTitle: Demi Moore's Golden Globes Win Celebrated by Daughters
